resources.string: A huge shopping district where you can find almost anything!
Seoul\'s shopping mecca filled with beauty outlets, street stalls, and more
The first royal palace built during the Joseon dynasty
One of the most popular ways to see Seoul\'s skyline
Experience Korea\'s traditional charm through food and shopping
The largest traditional market in Korea with over 10,000 stores
Once used as a fortress in the past, it is now a scenic way to explore the city
Ddeokbokki is a popular Korean street snack made from soft rice cake
Samgyupsal consist of thick slices of seasoned or unseasoned pork belly meat
"Bibimbap normally consists of rice topped with various vegetables "
it is a simple Korean seaweed rice roll with various ingredients inside
"Warm spicy stew consists of uncurdled tofu with various vegetables "
Odeng is Korean fish cake that is normally cooked in hot warm savory broth
it is a common fried noodle dish in Korea made from sweet potato noodle
A place where visitors can embrace the beauty of traditional Korean houses.
Gyeongbokgung was the first royal palace built by the Joseon Dynasty
The War Memorial of Korea was established to remember the Korean War
"the second grand palace of the Joseon Dynasty, built in 1405 by King Taejong "
This is a collection of five hanoks (traditional Korean houses) from the Joseon Dynasty
Find beautiful antique furniture, paintings, folk art and craft works
a traditional Korean village located to the west of Gyeongbokgung
Use your own two hands to make traditional handicraft items that were used in the past.
Full of passion and spirit, Korean traditional music captivates its listeners.
Have yourself a proper Korean dining experience.
See the passion and dedication that goes into Korean martial arts.
Learn how folks from ancient Korean history bonded and kept themselves entertained.
Beautiful and graceful performances with a rich history.
The Temple stay program not only brings you closer to nature, but also to yourself.
